prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: spwd standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: spwd Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth look at the spwd (Secure Password Hasher for Python) standard library module introduced in Python 3.12, which simplifies and secures password hashing.
key_points: spwd offers a built-in solution for secure password hashing
It is now part of the Python Standard Library as of version 3.12
Supports popular password hashing algorithms like Argon2, PBKDF2, and Scrypt
Provides an easy-to-use API with functions for hashing, verifying, and comparing passwords

code_examples.code:
import spwd

hashed_password = spwd.hashpw(b'my-password', spwd.crypto.argon2i)
verified = spwd.verify(spwd.crypt_password(b'user'), hashed_password)

version_notes: Improves security by providing a standard and secure method for password hashing
caveats: Ensure you use the correct version of Python (3.12 or later) to access this module.
Always consider using environment variables or secrets management tools for storing sensitive data like passwords
